TI: Attenuation of hippocampal kainic acid-induced seizures by substance P treatment.
AB: Adult male Wistar rats (n = 21) received bilateral kainic acid lesions of their hippocampi. Over a period of 9 weeks the animals received daily IP injections of either 5 micrograms/kg or 50 micrograms/kg substance P (SP) or vehicle. Seizures provoked by the lesions were suppressed by the daily administration of the neuropeptide SP in a dose of 50 micrograms/kg for the whole period of observation. The neurokinin significantly (p < 0.01) reduced the number of seizures compared to the vehicle-treated animals.
AD: Institute of Physiological Psychology I, University of Dusseldorf, Germany.
